rules.rule_text_en: Use still for something that continues; it often goes before the main verb (and after be).
rules.rule_text_uk: Still вживаємо, коли дія/ситуація триває; зазвичай воно стоїть перед основним дієсловом (а після be).
rules.rule_short_en: still = continuing; position in the middle
rules.rule_short_uk: still = триває; позиція в середині речення
examples: It’s 10 a.m. and Mia is still asleep.
I still don’t know his surname.
We’re still waiting for the bus.

rules.rule_text_en: Use not … any more/any longer or no longer to say something has stopped or changed.
rules.rule_text_uk: Not … any more/any longer або no longer вживаємо, коли щось припинилося або змінилося.
rules.rule_short_en: not … any more / no longer = not now
rules.rule_short_uk: not … any more / no longer = вже ні
examples: I don’t live there any more.
They no longer work together.
She doesn’t call me any longer.

rules.rule_text_en: Use yet mostly in negatives and questions to mean 'up to now' (expected later).
rules.rule_text_uk: Yet здебільшого вживаємо в запереченнях і питаннях: «досі/ще» (очікується пізніше).
examples: Have you finished yet?
I haven’t sent it yet.
Is he here yet?

rules.rule_text_en: Use already to say something happened earlier than expected; it usually goes in the middle.
rules.rule_text_uk: Already вживаємо, коли щось сталося раніше, ніж очікували; зазвичай стоїть у середині речення.
examples: I’ve already paid the bill.
She’s already left.
Are you already ready?

rules.rule_text_en: Even highlights something surprising or unexpected compared to what you would normally expect.
rules.rule_text_uk: Even підкреслює щось дивне/несподіване порівняно з тим, що зазвичай очікують.
examples: He remembered my birthday, even my middle name.
It’s cold here, even in April.
I couldn’t hear her, even with headphones.

rules.rule_text_en: Even can go before the part you want to emphasise (a noun phrase, time, place, etc.).
rules.rule_text_uk: Even може стояти перед тим, що підкреслюємо (іменник, час, місце тощо).
examples: Even my boss agreed.
She invited everyone, even her ex.
We worked all day, even on Sunday.

rules.rule_text_en: With a verb, even usually goes in the middle: before the main verb, after be/auxiliaries.
rules.rule_text_uk: З дієсловом even зазвичай стоїть у середині: перед основним дієсловом, після be/допоміжних.
rules.rule_short_en: position: be/aux + even; even + main verb
examples: I even forgot your message.
She has even met the CEO.
They were even arguing about it.

rules.rule_text_en: Not even means 'including this (surprising) thing, it didn’t happen / wasn’t true'.
rules.rule_text_uk: Not even означає: «навіть це (несподіване) не сталося/не було правдою».
examples: He didn’t say goodbye, not even to me.
Not even the experts knew the answer.
I wasn’t angry— not even annoyed.

rules.rule_text_en: Use although/though/even though to introduce a contrast clause (it is true, but…).
rules.rule_text_uk: Although/though/even though вводять підрядне речення протиставлення: «хоча…, але…».
examples: Although it was late, we kept working.
I went out, even though I was tired.
Though she apologised, he stayed angry.

rules.rule_text_en: Use in spite of / despite + noun or -ing for contrast (not followed by a full clause without of).
rules.rule_text_uk: In spite of / despite вживаємо з іменником або -ing для протиставлення (не з повним реченням без of).
examples: Despite the rain, we played.
In spite of feeling ill, he went to work.
Despite having little time, she helped.

rules.rule_text_en: You can use despite/in spite of + the fact that + clause, or although/though + clause.
rules.rule_text_uk: Можна: despite/in spite of the fact that + підрядне, або although/though + підрядне.
examples: Despite the fact that it was expensive, I bought it.
Although it was expensive, I bought it.
In spite of the fact that he was new, he led the meeting.

rules.rule_text_en: Though can be used at the end of a sentence (= however) in informal style.
rules.rule_text_uk: Though можна ставити в кінці речення (= however) у розмовному стилі.
examples: I like the city. It’s noisy, though.
We didn’t win. We played well, though.
It was hard. Worth it, though.

rules.rule_text_en: Even though is for real contrast; even if is for an imagined condition.
rules.rule_text_uk: Even though — реальний факт; even if — уявна умова («навіть якщо»).
examples: I stayed, even though I was exhausted.
I’ll go, even if it rains.
Even if you disagree, listen first.

rules.rule_text_en: In case means 'because it is possible this will happen'; you do something as a precaution.
rules.rule_text_uk: In case означає «тому що це може статися»; дія як запобіжний захід.
examples: Take a charger in case your phone dies.
I wrote the address down in case I forgot it.
Keep the receipt in case you need to return it.

rules.rule_text_en: Just in case makes the precaution idea stronger; it often comes at the end.
rules.rule_text_uk: Just in case підсилює ідею запобіжного заходу; часто стоїть наприкінці.
rules.rule_short_en: just in case = for extra safety
rules.rule_short_uk: just in case = на всяк випадок
examples: I’ll bring an umbrella, just in case.
Send me a copy, just in case you lose yours.
I saved the file twice, just in case.

rules.rule_text_en: Use if for a condition/result; use in case for a precaution (not the same meaning).
rules.rule_text_uk: If — умова/результат; in case — запобіжний захід (значення інше).
examples: If it rains, we’ll stay home.
Take a raincoat in case it rains.
Call me if you’re late.

rules.rule_text_en: In case of + noun (or -ing) is used without a clause: in case of fire, in case of delays.
rules.rule_text_uk: In case of + іменник (або -ing) вживається без підрядного: in case of fire, in case of delays.
examples: In case of emergency, press this button.
In case of delays, we’ll email you.
In case of losing the key, contact reception.

rules.rule_text_en: Unless means 'if not'. It introduces the only condition that stops something.
rules.rule_text_uk: Unless означає «якщо не». Це умова, яка зупиняє дію/результат.
examples: I’ll go unless you want me to stay.
Unless you hurry, you’ll miss the train.
We can’t start unless everyone is here.

rules.rule_text_en: As long as / so long as / provided (that) mean 'only if' (a strict condition).
rules.rule_text_uk: As long as / so long as / provided (that) означають «лише за умови, що».
rules.rule_short_en: as long as / provided = only if
rules.rule_short_uk: as long as / provided = лише якщо
examples: You can borrow it as long as you return it today.
We’ll help provided that you tell the truth.
You can stay here so long as you’re quiet.

rules.rule_text_en: Unless is not used for unreal conditions with would; use if … not instead in that case.
rules.rule_text_uk: Unless зазвичай не вживають у нереальних умовах з would; тоді краще if … not.
examples: I wouldn’t go if I didn’t have to.
If you didn’t help, I’d fail.
I’d be lost if I didn’t have a map.

rules.rule_text_en: Use as to mean 'while/at the same time': two actions happen together.
rules.rule_text_uk: As означає «поки/одночасно»: дві дії відбуваються разом.
examples: As I was walking home, it started to snow.
I listened to a podcast as I cooked.
As the day went on, it got colder.

rules.rule_text_en: As can also mean 'because'. Use when (not as) if one thing happens after another.
rules.rule_text_uk: As також означає «бо». When (не as) — коли одна дія стається після іншої.
examples: As it was late, we took a taxi.
When I got home, I called you.
As I didn’t have cash, I paid by card.

rules.rule_text_en: Use as + subject + verb for 'in the same way as'. Like is often possible in informal speech.
rules.rule_text_uk: As + підмет + присудок: «так само як». У розмовній мові часто можна like.
rules.rule_short_en: as + S+V = in the same way
examples: Do it as I showed you.
Leave it as it is.
Nobody reacted as I expected.

rules.rule_text_en: Fixed phrases: as usual / as always; and the same as (not the same like).
rules.rule_text_uk: Стійкі фрази: as usual / as always; та the same as (не the same like).
examples: He was late as usual.
As always, she was calm.
My answer is the same as yours.

rules.rule_text_en: We use like + noun for examples (like / such as).
rules.rule_text_uk: Like + іменник: приклади (like / such as).
examples: I enjoy sports like tennis and swimming.
We sell snacks such as nuts and fruit.
Cities like Lviv and Odesa are popular.

rules.rule_text_en: Expressions: as you know / as I said / do as you like (= do what you want).
rules.rule_text_uk: Вирази: as you know / as I said / do as you like (= роби як хочеш).
rules.rule_short_en: as you know; do as you like
rules.rule_short_uk: as you know; do as you like
examples: As you know, the shop is closed.
Do as you like—it's your decision.
As I said, I can’t meet today.

rules.rule_text_en: Use like / as if / as though + clause after look/sound/seem etc. to describe impressions.
rules.rule_text_uk: Після look/sound/seem тощо: like / as if / as though + підрядне для враження.
examples: It looks like it’s going to rain.
You sound as if you’re tired.
She seems as though she knows them.

rules.rule_text_en: Like/as if/as though can follow other verbs to say how someone does something.
rules.rule_text_uk: Like/as if/as though можуть іти після інших дієслів, щоб описати манеру дії.
rules.rule_short_en: He spoke as if… / ran like…
rules.rule_short_uk: He spoke as if… / ran like…
examples: He acted as if nothing happened.
She laughed like she didn’t care.
They stared at me as though I was crazy.

rules.rule_text_en: After as if/as though we sometimes use past forms to talk about the present (unreal).
rules.rule_text_uk: Після as if/as though інколи вживають минулий час про теперішнє (нереальність).
examples: He talks as if he knew everything.
She looks as though she was ill.
You treat me as if I were a child.

rules.rule_text_en: We often use were (not was) after as if in more formal/unreal style, especially with I/he/she/it.
rules.rule_text_uk: Після as if у більш формальному/нереальному стилі часто вживають were (не was), особливо з I/he/she/it.
examples: He speaks to me as if I were invisible.
It looks as if it were broken.
She smiled as if she were relieved.

rules.rule_text_en: Use for + a period to say how long; not during for duration.
rules.rule_text_uk: For + проміжок часу: тривалість; не during для тривалості.
examples: We talked for ten minutes.
I lived there for two years.
She’s been away for a week.

rules.rule_text_en: Use during to say when something happened within a period (during the meeting/night).
rules.rule_text_uk: During вживаємо, щоб сказати коли сталося щось у межах періоду (during the meeting/night).
rules.rule_short_en: during = at some point in a period
examples: I fell asleep during the film.
Nobody spoke during the presentation.
It rained during the night.

rules.rule_text_en: Use while + clause for two actions at the same time; while + -ing is also possible.
rules.rule_text_uk: While + підрядне: дві дії одночасно; можливе також while + -ing.
examples: I read while she cooked.
While waiting, I checked my email.
He called while I was driving.

rules.rule_text_en: By + time means 'not later than' (deadline): on or before that time.
rules.rule_text_uk: By + час означає «не пізніше ніж» (дедлайн): до або в цей час.
examples: Please reply by Friday.
Be home by 6.
The parcel should arrive by Monday.

rules.rule_text_en: By the time + clause shows one action is finished before another time/event.
rules.rule_text_uk: By the time + підрядне: одна дія завершиться до іншого моменту/події.
rules.rule_short_uk: by the time = до того часу
examples: By the time we arrived, the show had started.
By the time you wake up, I’ll be gone.
She’ll have finished by the time you call.

rules.rule_text_en: Until shows something continues up to a time; by shows completion before a time.
rules.rule_text_uk: Until: дія триває до моменту; by: завершення до моменту.
examples: I’ll wait until 5.
I’ll finish it by 5.
He’ll be away until Monday.
